iati-activity.title: Congo Basin Forest Fund (CBFF) Start Up Programme
iati-activity.description: Start-up funding for the interim establishment and operation of the Congo Basin Forest Fund (CBFF) and the delivery of a small regional project portfolio responding to immediate national and regional demands and pressures faced by the forests of the Congo Basin. It is intended that this will signal to national, regional and international stakeholders that the CBFF will be focusing on initiatives which directly or indirectly conserve forests in the Congo Basin region and provide local communities with sustainable livelihoods, while maintaining forestârelated environmental benefits to the global community.

iati-activity.title: AU Reform Support Programme
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the Africa Union Support Programme is to help stimulate effective reform within the Africa Union. This will include encouraging and supporting reformers and advising on reform processes, including planning and management of implementation. The programme will not provide any significant assistance with the direct implementation of reforms. Such assistance should be provided through other means, including the Institutional Transformation Programme (ITP).

iati-activity.title: Engaging Stakeholders on Domestic Resource Mobilisation in Sub-Saharan Africa
iati-activity.description: Sub-Saharan Africa faces significant financial resource gaps in meeting its developmental needs. These gaps can be financed through external resource mobilisation (eg. through ODA and FDI) and through enhanced domestic resource mobilisation (DRM), which entails increasing and enhancing domestic savings mobilisation, improving financial sector performance and enhancing public sector revenue collection and expenditure.

iati-activity.title: Support to the Cotton Four Countries in Shaping the Us Cotton Agenda
iati-activity.description: Project is to support a mission to the US, including co-ordinating the Cotton Four (C4) - Benin, Burkina Fasa, Chad and Mali, organising and co-hosting a conference and doing analytical work. iati-activity.title: Green Africa Power (GAP): Renewable Energy for Africa
iati-activity.description: To increase private sector investment in renewable energy, by providing early stage finance to private sector renewable energy generation projects in Africa. This will enable up to 10 renewable power plants to be financed, generating enough energy for 9 million consumers. This contributes towards our commitments to help combat climate change and will help avoid about 2.3m tonnes of carbon emissions.

iati-activity.title: Maximising Benefits of Extractives for Sustainable Growth
iati-activity.description: This scoping exercise will (i) identify how extractives affect governance arrangements and economic decisions, and vice-versa, in countries and regions (particularly Africa) (ii) learn from how some DFID programmes have addressed these issues, including working with other cadres and partners (iii) collate key questions for further elaboration on the issues that DFID needs to consider to ensure extractives deliver sustainable growth and development. (BC Quest doc ref. 3272981)

iati-activity.title: Toward Ending Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting in Africa and Beyond
iati-activity.description: This programme combines targeted action with communities in at least 15 countries with support for legislative and policy change and effective implementation of laws and policies. It includes a robust international research component to build the global evidence base on the most effective strategies to end FGM/C. It will work with others to support a movement within countries and globally to raise awareness and understanding of FGM/C and build support for efforts to end the practice. This programme aims to see a reduction of cutting by 30% in 10 countries over 5 years, with a vision to see an end to the practice in one generation.

contact-info.mailing-address: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

iati-activity.title: Carbon Market Finance for Africa (CMF-Africa)
iati-activity.description: The project will transform the use of Clean Development Mechanism and other carbon market finance in Africa, for increased access to small scale, low carbon energy applications in rural areas. This will be through demonstrating the practical use and financial viability of innovative "standardised baselines" and new approaches to bundle small scale CDM projects (programmatic approaches)

iati-activity.title: IPBES - Building the evidence base for effective policy making on biodiversity, ecosystem services and wealth generation
iati-activity.description: The aim of this project is to ensure that international and national policies on biodiversity and ecosystem services are based on a solid evidence. The project supports the establishment and initial functioning costs of the Intergovernmental Panel on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES), a mechanism that was set up recently to inform policies on biodiversity and ecosystem services in the same way the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) informs international policy making on climate change. Our support complements a contribution from Defra and will help facilitate stronger developing country participation in decisions made by IPBES.

iati-activity.title: Africa Risk Capacity (ARC)
iati-activity.description: To support an index-based weather risk insurance pool that will provide participating African countries with predictable, quick-disbursing funds in the case of a drought to implement pre-defined contingency response plans. By introducing new approaches of identifying, quantifying and managing the financial risk of disasters, and by linking insurance payouts to effective operational response plans, the African Risk Capacity aims to create a new way of managing weather risk in Africa and to build capacity within AU member states to manage these predictable risks instead of managing the crises these risks cause.

iati-activity.title: Bioenergy/Biofuels Scoping Review: a review, mapping and analysis and analysis of key research and evidence
iati-activity.description: DFID will provide funds to conduct a review and analysis of key research and evidence relating to the biofuels sector in developing countries, its validity as a commercially viable energy supply and its impact on a number of issues such as economic growth, energy efficiency, poverty reduction, and food security. The proposed intervention will also provide a detailed mapping of current research against a list of key issues relevant to DFID priorities.

iati-activity.title: Mobile Enabled Community Services
iati-activity.description: To work jointly with the industry group representing mobile phone operators worldwide, GSMA (Group Speciale Mobile Association) and its subsidiary Mobile for Development Group, to identify and support the development and use of new, innovative ways in which mobile phone technologies and mobile network infrastructure can be used to improve the reach, delivery and affordability of basic energy and water services to poor people in Africa and Asia. As a result of this work some 4 million poor people are expected to benefit from improved access to basic energy and water services by 2020
